result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey W Reiss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant eligible for earned release (substance abuse) program after serving 24 months of this sentence in custody.
Consecutive to: Milwaukee County Case

superMiscConds.notes: Fines and costs are due during term of supervision. Court further orders 25% of prison wages to be applied toward Court-ordered financial obligations.  If defendant is released with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Not to possess or consume controlled substances or prescription medication w/out a valid prescription from a physician or physician's assistant. Container must be available for inspection.
Notify doctor of pharmaceutical recreational substance abuse.
No drug paraphernalia.
Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Pay all supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Dineen requested file-stamped copies of the Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, however there were not any copies mailed to the COC.

Defendant Jeffrey W Reiss appears by video from Dodge Correctional, in custody. Attorney Nathan John Dineen in court.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court examines defendant regarding appearance by video. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. Court gives voting restriction and firearm warning to defendant orally in court. Court renders sentence.
Clerk arranged for def to appear by video from Dodge Correctional on 9/18 at 1:30 pm. Counsel called to change time to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffrey W Reiss in court with attorney Dan Skarie.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Defendant Jeffrey W Reiss in court with Attorney Secura but advises Atty Dineen will be representing.  Defendant in custody and appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail. Jeffrey Alan Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of the penalties.  State recommends $7500 cash bail w/conditions.  Court orders $10,000 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; No controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; SCRAM Bracelet upon posting bail; not to operate a motor vehicle. Counsel requesting status of prelim hrg; waiving timelimits.  Status hearing scheduled for March 19, 2015 at 08:45 am.
